senses.de: A popular or latest style of clothing, hair, decoration, or behavior

Tips.title: Fashion Evolution
Tips.description: Fashion often changes rapidly, so what's in could soon be out.
Tips.example: Flared jeans were once the height of fashion.

Tips.title: Cultural Indicator
Tips.description: Fashion can reflect cultural shifts, symbolizing societal changes.
Tips.example: The miniskirt became fashion in the 1960s' social revolution.

Tips.title: Personal Expression
Tips.description: Fashion can be a form of self-expression, not just following trends.
Tips.example: He uses fashion to show his unique personality.

senses.ex: After the fashion of his class.

Tips.title: Figurative Use
Tips.description: 'Fashion' can describe a way of doing things, not just style.
Tips.example: They settled the dispute in a peaceful fashion.

Tips.title: Variety of Applications
Tips.description: 'Fashion' can refer to behavior, methods, or any other regular manner of acting.
Tips.example: He recounts his adventures in a grand fashion.

Tips.title: Imitation Involved
Tips.description: Acting 'in the fashion of' often implies imitation or following an example.
Tips.example: The novices sought to conduct their duties in the fashion of the masters.

senses.ex: He fashioned a bow out of a twig.

Tips.title: Creativity Implied
Tips.description: Using 'fashion' as a verb implies crafting with creativity or artistry.
Tips.example: She fashioned a unique costume from vintage clothes.

Tips.title: Transformative Connotation
Tips.description: 'Fashion into' signals turning something ordinary into something special.
Tips.example: From simple ingredients, he fashioned an extraordinary meal.

senses.de: Clothes, especially good or stylish clothes
senses.ex: He always buys his clothes at a fashionable men's store.

Tips.title: Beyond Clothing
Tips.description: 'Fashion' implies more than clothes, it can denote lifestyle and class.
Tips.example: Designer labels can signal a high-fashion lifestyle.

Tips.title: Street Fashion
Tips.description: Street fashion is influenced by youth culture and is not always designer-made.
Tips.example: His street fashion sense always turns heads.

senses.de: A way of behaving or way of doing things
senses.ex: The company was run in an orderly fashion.

Tips.title: Generalized Method
Tips.description: 'Fashion' suggests a particular way or method that may not be formalized.
Tips.example: The meetings are held in an informal fashion.

Tips.title: Order of Actions
Tips.description: 'Fashion' can hint at the sequence or manner activities are carried out.
Tips.example: The project was completed in a systematic fashion.

Convention.wordDefinition:
Convention refers to a standard or a traditional practice that is widely accepted by a particular group of people or society.

Convention is a standard that is followed for a long time, while fashion is a trend that people follow only for a short period.

Form.wordDefinition:
Form refers to the way something is arranged or structured.

Fashion is applicable when referring to the latest trends in clothing and personal appearance while form is applicable in many other areas such as the shape of an object, the structure of a sentence, or the arrangement of a painting.

Manner.wordDefinition:
Fashion refers to a popular trend in clothing or style, while manner refers to the way something is done or the behavior exhibited.

For example, "The latest fashion trend is to wear oversized sweatshirts" refers to a popular clothing style, while "She spoke in a quiet and polite manner" refers to someone's behavior or way of speaking.

Fashion is applicable primarily in the context of clothing, accessories and style, while manner can be used in a variety of contexts such as speech, behavior, and conduct.

Mode.wordDefinition:
Mode refers to a general pattern or way of doing things that is commonly accepted or used.

Fashion is specifically related to clothing and accessories, and it changes quickly according to trends and influences, while mode is a more general term that can refer to many aspects of life, including but not limited to style and trends.

Style.wordDefinition:
Fashion refers to the latest trends and styles in clothing, accessories, and beauty products, which can change frequently.

Style refers to an individual's personal expression through clothing, accessories, and grooming. It is more timeless and less focused on trends, and involves understanding one's own preferences, body type, and personality.

Style can be both fashionable and classic, and is often about finding what looks and feels good for an individual.

Fashion is about keeping up with what's currently popular, while style is about developing a unique personal expression.

Trend.wordDefinition:
Fashion refers to a general style or design that lasts for a long time, while a trend refers to a popular style that is temporary and changes frequently.

A trend is applicable to clothes, makeup, hairstyles, and other appearances, and it usually fades out after a short period of time.

In simpler terms, fashion is timeless and classic, while trends are fun and fleeting.

Vogue.wordDefinition:
Fashion refers to a popular trend or style of clothing, accessories and other items of personal adornment. Vogue is a term used to describe the latest trends and styles that are considered popular in a particular time period.

While fashion can be timeless and classic, vogue is always changing and refers to what is currently trendy. Both terms can be used in the context of clothing as well as other areas of design such as home decor or graphic design.

Way.wordDefinition:
Way refers to a method or manner in which something is done or achieved.

It's a broader term and can be used for different things like a way of living, way of speaking, way of solving a problem, and so on.

Fashion is more specific and related to trends in clothing and style, while way is a more general term that can be applicable to various areas of life.

quotes.Text: We really shouldn't be putting a label on size. Fashion is for all, and I think confidence and happiness is more important than dress labels.
quotes.Title: English Celebrity
quotes.Name: Jameela Jamil

quotes.Text: He is not a true man of the world who knows only the present fashions of it.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.Text: I think music influences fashion and has done so for generations.
quotes.Title: English Model
quotes.Name: Georgia May Jagger

quotes.Text: Obviously fashion is a completely different world from football.
quotes.Title: French Athlete
quotes.Name: Zinedine Zidane

quotes.Text: I'm not sure people understand how important fashion is to me.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Gunna

quotes.Text: Don't be afraid. There is no right answer in fashion.
quotes.Title: South Korean Musician
quotes.Name: G-Dragon

quotes.Text: I really like to live my life in a low-key fashion.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Alicia Keys

quotes.Text: I love fashion, but fashion is not my whole life.
quotes.Title: Chinese Designer
quotes.Name: John Rocha

quotes.Text: A good model can advance fashion by ten years.
quotes.Title: French Designer
quotes.Name: Yves Saint Laurent

quotes.Text: Taste is so much more important than fashion.
quotes.Title: Austrian Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Hattie Carnegie
